data.event: The population was 4,950 at the 2010 census which allows Salem to become a Class 3 city in Missouri; however, the city has chosen to remain a Class 4 city under Missouri Revised Statutes.
In 1851 the Missouri Assembly created Dent County from Crawford and Shannon counties.
A log courthouse, built about 1851 or 1852, was Dent County's first and was located on the Wingfield farm northeast of Salem.

event.title: 1852, was Dent County's first and was located

data.event: A log courthouse, built about 1851 or 1852, was Dent County's first and was located on the Wingfield farm northeast of Salem.

event.title: became the first mayor of Salem in 1860

data.event: W. P. Williams became the first mayor of Salem in 1860, just after the Missouri State Legislature passed laws regarding the administration of village government.
In 1881, Salem was incorporated as a town.
